p: Influenza surveillance in France is coordinated by French national public health agency (ie, Santé publique France) including hospitals, laboratories and primary care networks. 9 The French primary care surveillance network—called Sentinelles, participate in monitoring influenza epidemics since 1984 through a sample of general practitioners (GPs) reporting on a weekly basis all ILI cases seen in consultation. 10 ILI definition used had a high predictive value for influenza although other respiratory viruses could cause ILI. 11 This definition has remained unchanged over the period, allowing study of trends in ILI. There were no steady influenza virological database available in primary care since 1984, as this laboratory surveillance has evolved, first coordinated by the GROG— Groupes Régionaux d'Observation de la Grippe, before 2014 12 and then by the Sentinelles network. 13, 14
